Summary: large orange light slowly moving from over land to water approx 500 feet above water
trends: There have been 20 other sightings in Syracuse
There were no other sightings in Syracuse on or around July 11th 2006
divs: sighting detailsmy friend and i were out on my boat on oneida lake for a late nite of fishing having done this countless times,we launched at approx 11:00pm absolutely clear skies every starin the ski was out a beautiful night to be fishing.when fishing you cant help but look at stars and such. i have seen all kinds of air planes,satalites shooting stars and such on the lake quiet you can here and see propeller planes in the area of 1-4 miles away no problem.at approx 1:40am this constant orange light over near larkin point(south shore)slowly moved towards the lake no sound. i thoght it was the local sheriff helicopter at first but once it was over water only 1\2 mile from us there was still no sound and i knew it was not the sheriff helicopter there is other lights on the bottom of the chopper. this object moved appropx 3 miles in 40 minutes we stared at this object in total curiosity not afraid or anything.the object i can only say was a large light 20-30 feet across the light was constant not a strobe. watching this was more exiting than the fishing(nothing biting) after sitting not catching any thing we decided to call it a nite,the object was in line between us and the boat launch i say to my friend we will go under it on the way in (it now hovering over the lake) we were only 3\4 from the launch.as we headed in this object went in reverse from a stopped position i was moving slow at first it moved slow as we headed init took it same flight path back inland we only go as close as 1\4 mile still no sound it went back over land inland 1\2 mile or so. now were approching the boat launch not taking our eyes off it for a split second and it was gone. i have seen many aviation aircraft shows on tv and in person me believing it's got to be aregular air is the first thing in my mind but it clearly was not.
